issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The Application master needs the application attempt id to register with the Applications Manager. To create an appAttemptId object, the appId object(needs cluster timestamp and app id) and failCount are needed.

Currently, all clients need to pass in the appId, cluster timestamp and fail count to the app master for the required objects to be constructed. 

We could look at simplifying this by providing either placeholders that would have values replaced by the app master launcher or setting it  into the environment ( although that requires a set of whitelisted env vars that can only be set by the yarn framework ).
fields.summary: Simplify parameter passing to Application Master from Client. SImplify approach to pass info such  appId, ClusterTimestamp and failcount required by App Master.

comments.body:
ApplicationAttemptID was originally introduced for the same reason, it has appId, clusterTimeStamp and failcount(attemptId).

Passing it via environment is the correct API and the original intention (I had a TODO in AMLauncher :) )

Hey Vinod,

Hehe, yeah I came across that TODO. I also agree that environment variable is the right way to do this. The question I have is, do we only need to pass the attempt ID, or do we also need to pass the app ID and cluster timestamp? It seems to me that we need all three, unless I'm missing something (which I probably am).

Cheers,
Chris

We will pass ApplicationAttemptID serialized as a string of the form {{appattempt_$clusterTimeStamp_$appId_$attemptId}}. You can use YARN's TypeConverter utilities to convert it back into a record and use any/all of the fields.
+1 on passing ApplicationAttemptID as a string in the env as Vinod suggested.

Attaching patch that should fix this.
 - Introduced "APPLICATION_ATTEMPT_ID_ENV" environmental variable.
 - Changed MRAppMaster to use the same.
 - Added a test that should verify this. Knocked off an old, commented-out test that became redundant with my new one.

+1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12496116/MAPREDUCE-3055-20110922.txt
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    +1 tests included.  The patch appears to include 7 new or modified tests.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/824//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/824//console

This message is automatically generated.

Minor nits:

# We need error handling in MRAppMaster if the env is not proper
# Rename the env APPLICATION_ATTEMPT_ID_ENV -> APPLICATION_ATTEMPT_ID
# Misc. changes in webapp???

Patch addressing the comments.

Webapp changes are related to the changes in the utility methods.

+1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
